title: Change admin dashboard URL path to a custom less-obvious route

requirements.summary: Change the admin dashboard route from '/admin' to '/pindpahadi-manage-2024' and update all internal references
acceptanceCriteria: Navigating to '/pindpahadi-manage-2024' loads the password-protected admin dashboard
Navigating to '/admin' no longer loads the admin dashboard (404 or redirects to home)
All internal links or programmatic navigations that previously pointed to '/admin' now point to '/pindpahadi-manage-2024'
The new path does not appear in the main navigation header or mobile sticky bar

file_operations.description: Update the router configuration to change the admin route path from '/admin' to '/pindpahadi-manage-2024'. Modify the Route component definition for the admin dashboard to use the new path. Ensure the route remains standalone without the site layout wrapper (no Header/Footer/MobileStickyBar). Remove or update any route guards or redirects that reference '/admin'.

Update any internal navigation logic, programmatic redirects, or hardcoded path references within the admin dashboard component that point to '/admin' to use '/pindpahadi-manage-2024' instead. Ensure success/failure flows and any redirect logic after password entry use the correct new path.

Review the desktop navigation links and mobile hamburger drawer menu. If any link to '/admin' exists (unlikely per current implementation), remove it or ensure it does not expose the new admin path '/pindpahadi-manage-2024'. Confirm the admin route remains hidden from all visible navigation.
Verify that the mobile sticky navigation bar does not include any link or reference to '/admin' or '/pindpahadi-manage-2024'. Ensure the new admin path remains unexposed in the mobile navigation UI.
Review the footer quick navigation links. If any link to '/admin' exists, remove it or ensure the new admin path '/pindpahadi-manage-2024' is not exposed in the footer navigation.
